1000 stat gain17502100217021842186
1500 stat gain22502700279028082811

2500 stat gain32503900403040564061

as you can see we have our work cut out for us to make a maxed monster this is starting with a 750 composite start monster. as you can see with this monster you would need to gain over 3000 to max.

By mepersoner on Sunday, October 14, 2001 - 02:34 pm:

Ok the stat gain is in a lifetime. (you gain a 1000 points in a lifetime) The gens are the the monster after being trained and having the heart crystals used on them, the total stats added together. 4995 would be a maxed monster.

By superbk on Sunday, October 14, 2001 - 02:39 pm:

this says that the theories of maxing monsters with hearts just isnt possible without huge stat gains in a lifetime.

By torey luvullo on Sunday, October 14, 2001 - 03:04 pm:

ok - let me break it down a different way. assume that a basic encyclopedia monster starts with a composite 795. that's not bad - thats an average of almost 160 per category. now assume, as psych0midget showed in his maxing thread [posted elsewhere] that a good jumping off point is a heart of a monster with 3 maxed stats. at 20% passed on, that's an additional 600 points to be gained at some time during the recipient monster's life. finally, assume a 5 year lifespan - we know that can be done.

max points4995
encyclopedia points795
heart points600
_______ _______
remaining to be earned during lifetime3600


4 wks/mo x 12 mo/yr x 5 yrs = 240 wks

3600 divided by 240 = 15

that is the magic number. to totally max a monster [using these assumptions] you must gain an average of 15 pts/wk in one of the 5 categories.

let's go to work! we can find a way to attain this average, change the assumptions so that they are more favorable to us, or a little of both.

By danz on Sunday, October 14, 2001 - 09:39 pm:
